intro: Randia veracruzana, commonly known as the Mexican randia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and range in color from white to pink, adding ornamental value to gardens. Randia veracruzana is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
